body_html:
In my testing cuDNN 7 (with CUDA 8) it does seem to have some improved Kernels. cuDNN 6 did not seem to have much of an impact I saw a speed up in Single GPU performance for VGG16 and ResNet when testing on P100s. I have not tested on K80s. We are still working through any minor issues with TensorFlow. The upgrades are not always plug and play. This is a fine place to ask, I just did not want answer compile questions for platforms I am not using for this very unofficial patch. :-)
…

In my testing cuDNN 7 (with CUDA 8) it does seem to have some improved
Kernels. cuDNN 6 did not seem to have much of an impact  I saw a speed up
in Single GPU performance for VGG16 and ResNet when testing on P100s.  I

body:
In my testing cuDNN 7 (with CUDA 8) it does seem to have some improved
Kernels. cuDNN 6 did not seem to have much of an impact  I saw a speed up
in Single GPU performance for VGG16 and ResNet when testing on P100s.  I
have not tested on K80s.  We are still working through any minor issues
with TensorFlow.  The upgrades are not always plug and play.  This is a
fine place to ask, I just did not want answer compile questions for
platforms I am not using for this very unofficial patch.  :-)
